stories.title: Show HN: Nano – tap your Wirex card to spend your nano anywhere
How the Internet can cause ADHD-like symptoms

stories.text:
Hello I found the exact name of the file im interested in on predb, and on other databases. I found the DDL on "scnlog": -The "WEB0DAY_INT" (nuked, stolen from WEB, habit) Virustotal from 49 flags. -The "TSZ" Virustotal from 36 flags. Malwarebytes on PC also give me trojans for both. The ".nfo" files are identical to the release of the scene, for number/name/size of rar matches.

I trust the scene, I don't think 2 groups, have placed malware. How can i verify that the versions I own have not been tampered with? Is there a way to know if i have the same version of the release a compare between the checksums? How files would help me; .srr .diz .svf? How do i versify, do i need to do it before merging rar?

Thank you all.

P.S Link to the Virustoal checkup https://www.virustotal.com/gui/file/02a042cd7c47924fa0c5e4c2b5a990a6304ff4e81739a192d397dbc845df9861/detection

https://www.virustotal.com/gui/file/9bef8d8fb05c7a9aa11a73d8d480cb0f09ed02ec386b173dc7b34c998837a5c9

this is clean https://www.virustotal.com/gui/file/6af0af4b97af0eee1316fdb14742844ef962d488f732bd70ef4767098aef90fc/detection
stories.title: Verify the Legitimacy of a Release
Why you can't solve knowledge problems with information tools alone
The solution to the nightmare of truncated tab titles

stories.text:
Hey everyone. It might be nostalgia talking, but when I was a little kid I remember going to a store, finding a fascinating book on 3D game programming ( I think it was trying to do a Wolfenstein clone ) and not buying it ( it was ridiculously expensive at the time -- way more than I had saved ). Feels like a missed opportunity today.

Anyway, for the life of me, I do not remember anything other than it was C++, it was 90s, it was about making a 3d shooter clone game.

I tried Amazon, but nothing I found seems to match the memory. Does anyone may have an idea what the book title/author was/could be?
stories.title: Ask HN: Old C++ game programming book
Doubtlab – A Lab for Bad Labels
